Subjective: Dizziness for 3 days; worse with head movement. Nausea but no vomiting. Fear of brain tumor. No smoking/drugs/alcohol. Palpitations during dizziness. Impact: unable to function normally.
Objective: BP 110/70; Pulse 62. Normal cranial nerves. No nystagmus. Negative HIT test bilaterally. Positive Dix-Hallpike right > left.
Assessment: Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo (BPPV). No signs of brain tumor or central cause.
Plan: - Perform Epley maneuver in office; - Recommend home exercises; - Advise activity modification; - Follow-up in 1 week; - Safety net: worsening symptoms, severe headache, or neurological deficits.
